subject: RE: [junit] JFCUnit with modal dialogs
msgSnippet: Modal dialogs shouldn t be a problem if you create them from within the AWT Thread itself (which is a fairly typical way to use them, e.g. create a listener to
messageBody:
Modal dialogs shouldn't be a problem if you create them from within the AWT
Thread itself (which is a fairly typical way to use them, e.g. create a
listener to listen for an "OK" button press then create a modal dialog with
a response - the listener is executed from within the AWT Thread itself).

If you are creating the modal dialog from outside the AWT Thread for some
reason then you will need to create a new Thread to execute the code you are
testing.

Matt
